lines.text:
[after being cast out of the castle, Robin and Will are sitting by a fireplace in the woods. Heavy rain and thunder]
Let me guess... the horses have gone home?
Yes, the horses have gone home.
Congratulations.
Thank you.
I'm starved.
Me too.
It's raining.

[agreeing]
It's raining.
If only I hadn't encouraged you to stand up for the miller.
If only I hadn't listened.

[looking at each other, then in unison]
Bloody Normans!
So what are you going to do to me? Tie me up?
Could be a lashing.
How many strokes?
As many as are necessary.
And then it's finished?
That depends. Have you ever been lashed before?
I've never had someone make me beg them to stop.
Then you've never had a proper lashing.

I will not marry to symbolize a peace, or to ratify a treaty. But... this man I will have... because he makes the May tree blossom and the bees buzz in my breast. I will take this man because he brings springtime to my heart.
You are the most beautiful bride England has ever seen.
I am the most pitiful bride England has ever seen.
Let's settle this on a coin toss. Heads I win, tails he loses.

[watching Sir Miles Folcanet ride away from them]
My future husband is sulking.

[watching Robin Hood ride up to them]
Oh, I don't know, he looks quite happy to me.
Give me back my country.
Give me fifty men, I beg you!
No, Miles, I prefer a more subtle approach.
Subtle! Baron, sometimes you are so wet one could shoot snipe off you.
Welcome to hell!
Sam, can you make boxes?
Can I make boxes? Is Friar Tuck hungry?

[Approaches the Baron playing backgammon with Robert Hode aka Robin Hood]
Who's winning, uncle?
Robert, of course.

[Swings into the chapel and interrupts Marian's wedding to Miles Folcanet]
Good morning, Sir Miles!

[Staring at Sir Miles]
I do not want you.
I'm going to show him what an outlaw is and what an outlaw does!

[Robin and two outlaws have their swords at Tuck's throat]
So you'll be Robert Hode then?
Sir Robert, save me. Save me!
I order you to leave this man be, and to get off my land.
Well well, leave him be? Yes, of course we could do as you suggest. But the poacher will still have his eyes so he could poach again.
Thank you, Sir Robert, for your display of Saxon justice.
I believe Sir Robert never loses. So he tells me.
You should have killed him!
You should have kept your mouth shut!
You may be a Saxon, Sir Robert, but the Saxons no longer rule here.
You've got a twinkle in your eye.
Better than the sharp end of a dagger.

[Little John has just knocked Robin into rapids]
He can't swim!
You're free to go. Or stay if you think you've something to offer?
What could I offer to the man who has everything?

[Frowns]
Don't play games with me.
You're so handsome when you're angry.

[Swings his sword at Robin Hood]
Shall I bless you now or when you're dead?

[Has a knife on the corrupt Abbott]
I apologize, the steel is cold, it couldn't be helped.
What's your name?

[In disguise]
Martin. Martin Pride.
Pride. I like it.
It's no good pining for my brother Richard, he won't be back!

[about Robin Hood]
He merely wants Norman and Saxon to have respect for one another and be at peace.
Taxes are there to be hated by some, spent by others.
Who are you?

[Disguised as Martin Pride]
What a time to ask philosophical questions.

[Robin wants to give the money to the poor]
Give it away? All of it? You must be crazy!

[about the new longbows]
You know what I could do with a hundred of these?
You can scrub me, you can dip me in perfume. It's too late, Miles. What you want has already been given to another man, with the greatest pleasure!
I will not have Saxon mock Norman, and I will have my money.
